sites.title: NYC Capital Projects Dashboard
sites.description: Transparent municipal infrastructure planning combining project timelines, budget tracking, and interactive mapping for public accountability. Outstanding example of progressive disclosure serving both technical and citizen audiences.

sites.title: Seattle DOT Capital Projects
sites.description: Comprehensive transportation infrastructure visualization with real-time project status, budget tracking, and community impact assessment. Demonstrates how to present complex construction data in an accessible public interface.

sites.title: Charlotte, NC — Capital Projects
sites.description: Municipal planning dashboard showing capital improvement projects with geographic context and timeline visualization. Excellent example of how to organize large-scale infrastructure data for public understanding.

sites.title: Richmond, VA — Capital Improvement Program
sites.description: Strategic capital planning dashboard connecting infrastructure investments to community priorities. Shows how municipalities can align long-term planning with budget realities through interactive visualization.

sites.title: Richmond, CA — CIP (BETA)
sites.description: City-run CIP microsite that organizes active projects with capital categories, milestone narratives, and status indicators. Shows how smaller municipalities can deliver pipeline transparency without custom tooling.

sites.title: St. Helena, CA — CIP Dashboard
sites.description: ArcGIS dashboard summarizing water, street, and facility investments with filterable maps and budget tables. Highlights straightforward ways to mix spatial layers with progress reporting for local boards.

sites.title: Hillsborough County, FL — Project Map Viewer
sites.description: Countywide project map bridging dozens of transportation improvements with status filters and interactive timelines. Demonstrates how to scale map-first storytelling for a large capital program.

sites.title: Palm Coast, FL — Capital Projects
sites.description: Municipal capital dashboard that breaks projects into lifecycle stages with cost summaries and photo documentation. Useful reference for pairing story cards with GIS-powered detail pages.

sites.title: Jacksonville, FL — CIP Dashboard
sites.description: Transparency portal offering district filters, program categories, and status dials for hundreds of city projects. Illustrates how to keep a dense CIP dataset browsable for residents.

sites.title: Stuart, FL — Capital Improvement Projects
sites.description: Interactive dashboard with timeline widgets and expenditure charts tailored to a smaller coastal city. Great example of making complex CIP schedules digestible on a single page.

sites.title: Ann Arbor, MI — FY2026-2031 Capital Improvements Plan
sites.description: Public planning map linking multi-year investments to location, schedule, and funding source. Highlights how to pair long-range planning narratives with interactive map navigation.

sites.title: San Diego County, CA — 2025-2030 Capital Plan
sites.description: Engage platform briefing that walks residents through capital plan priorities, scoring criteria, and submission opportunities before linking to detailed data. Demonstrates narrative-first framing.

sites.title: Baltimore City, MD — FY25-30 Capital Improvement Program
sites.description: Comprehensive CIP recommendation PDF with score explanations, funding tables, and neighborhood summaries. Reference for documenting prioritization logic when interactive tooling is limited.

sites.title: Deerfield Beach, FL — Capital Project Dashboard
sites.description: ArcGIS dashboard focusing on water, roadway, and facility projects with stage-based status chips and dynamic budget totals. Shows how to manage multiple infrastructure types within one layout.

sites.title: Lawrence, KS — Capital Improvement Project Map
sites.description: Geospatial dashboard combining map bookmarks, KPI cards, and embedded construction photography. Useful for demonstrating progress storytelling at the project level.

sites.title: Morristown, TN — Capital Projects StoryMap
sites.description: ArcGIS StoryMap that narrates capital initiatives with scroll-driven copy, maps, and embedded media. Model for blending storytelling and capital data without a dense dashboard.

sites.title: Los Angeles County DPW — Projects
sites.description: County public works portal listing roadway, flood, and building projects with filterable status and open data exports. Shows how enterprise data can power a front-end catalog with actionable next steps.

sites.title: Torrance, CA — CIP Dashboard
sites.description: City dashboard layering project cards, funding charts, and milestone dates with optional OpenGov detail views. Demonstrates cross-linking between summary dashboards and deeper financial systems.

sites.title: Normal, IL — Community Investment Plan
sites.description: Community investment plan portal presenting five-year priorities with maps, cost breakdowns, and citizen FAQs. Helpful example of combining policy framing and operational data.

sites.title: Great Lakes Water Authority — Five-Year CIP (Power BI)
sites.description: Power BI report visualizing water utility capital projects with category filtering, funding status, and geographic drill-through. Demonstrates strong use of slicers and cards for regulated infrastructure reporting.

sites.title: Minneapolis Park & Recreation Board — CIP (Power BI)
sites.description: Power BI experience showcasing park capital improvements with district filters, priority rankings, and interactive charts. Illustrates how to translate CIP spreadsheets into responsive visuals.

sites.title: City of Norfolk, VA — Adopted CIP FY2025 (Power BI)
sites.description: Adopted CIP Power BI report detailing project phases, funding sources, and council priorities. Useful for exploring how governments tie narrative text to interactive fiscal views.

sites.title: Chesterfield County, VA — CIP Explorer (Power BI)
sites.description: Power BI explorer for county capital projects with scenario filters, map visuals, and commitment tracking. Demonstrates multi-page navigation tuned to different stakeholder questions.

sites.title: Envisio — Public Dashboard Examples (Gallery)
sites.description: Gallery of public sector dashboards illustrating performance alignment, strategic plan tracking, and capital updates. Reference for structuring case-study storytelling alongside live embeds.

sites.title: Acuity PPM — Portfolio Charts & Priority Heatmaps
sites.description: Deep dive into portfolio management chart types with screenshots, explanations, and use-case guidance. Helpful when selecting visualization patterns for executive storytelling.

sites.title: Aha! Roadmaps — Prioritization (Scorecards & Ranking)
sites.description: Sophisticated feature scoring system with real-time prioritization that demonstrates how quantitative models translate into visual hierarchy. Features inline editing, drag-and-drop ranking, and dynamic scorecard calculations.

sites.title: Productboard — Prioritization Matrix (Value × Effort)
sites.description: Documentation outlining Productboard's value-versus-effort matrix with configurable fields and roadmap tie-ins. Shows how product teams keep customer signals and prioritization logic in sync.

sites.title: airfocus — Priority Ratings & Scoring (Weighted Matrices)
sites.description: Flexible weighted scoring system that allows teams to create custom prioritization frameworks. Demonstrates how to make complex multi-criteria decision making accessible through visual interface design.

sites.title: Planview Advisor — Portfolio Visualizations (Bullseye, Treemap)
sites.description: Executive-ready portfolio optimization with advanced analytics showcasing multi-dimensional visualization including bubble charts, efficient frontier analysis, and scenario modeling for C-level decisions.

sites.title: Meisterplan — Portfolio Dashboard (Configurable Charts)
sites.description: Portfolio dashboard module with configurable charts for capacity, scenario comparisons, and prioritization heatmaps. Demonstrates how to communicate staffing impact alongside investment choices.

sites.title: OnePlan — Portfolio Modeler (Projects Ranked by Score)
sites.description: Portfolio modeler featuring ranking boards, what-if analysis, and investment balancing. Useful example for showing how sliders and presets speed decision cycles.

sites.title: Adobe Workfront — Portfolio Optimizer Score (Auto Ranking)
sites.description: Automated portfolio optimization that uses algorithmic scoring to rank projects by business value. Excellent example of how to present complex optimization algorithms in an understandable visual format.

sites.title: Apptio Targetprocess — WSJF Prioritization (SAFe)
sites.description: SAFe-oriented prioritization workflow with WSJF scoring, dependency mapping, and portfolio views. Helpful when translating agile ceremonies into executive summaries.

sites.title: Atlassian Jira Align — Prioritize Features (WSJF)
sites.description: Guidance on prioritizing features inside Jira Align with WSJF, lean business cases, and roadmap views. Shows how large enterprises coordinate prioritization at multiple layers.

sites.title: Microsoft Project — Portfolio Analysis Driver-Based Prioritization
sites.description: Documentation on driver-based portfolio analysis with prioritization, strategic alignment scores, and optimizer views. Reference for teams needing governance-heavy tooling.

sites.title: City of Boulder, CO — Zero Waste Dashboard
sites.description: Public-facing zero waste portal showing diversion performance, organics capture, and policy milestones. Helpful blueprint for pairing narrative context with live KPI tracking.

sites.title: San Francisco International Airport — Zero Waste Dashboard
sites.description: Operational Power BI experience detailing airport waste diversion, with deep dives on construction and demolition materials and tenant compliance.

sites.title: City of Oakland, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: Standardized Green Halo portal summarizing project-level diversion, recycling totals, and supporting certifications for Oakland's debris ordinance.

sites.title: Redwood City, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: City-specific Green Halo instance displaying construction recycling activity, recovery facilities, and permit summaries for Redwood City projects.

sites.title: Contra Costa County, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: Countywide Green Halo site consolidating debris diversion progress, approved facilities, and sustainability documentation requirements.

sites.title: City of Santa Monica, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: Santa Monica's debris recycling compliance portal showcasing project diversion percentages, recovery receipts, and material breakdowns.

sites.title: City of Lakewood, CO — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: Green Halo implementation highlighting construction material diversion dashboards, project status filters, and sustainability reporting for Lakewood.

sites.title: City of San José, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: San José's consolidated view of demolition and construction diversion, leveraging Green Halo's standardized analytics for municipal oversight.

sites.title: City of Carlsbad, CA — Green Halo Waste Tracking
sites.description: Carlsbad's debris recycling portal providing at-a-glance diversion scores, project inventory, and facility utilization insights.

sites.title: City of San Diego, CA — C&D Recycling Program
sites.description: Program hub detailing San Diego's construction and demolition recycling requirements, certified facilities, and compliance tools for permit holders.

sites.title: San Diego Mixed C&D Facilities — Historical Diversion Rates
sites.description: Quarterly PDF report documenting diversion performance for certified C&D processing facilities across San Diego.

sites.title: San Diego C&D Debris Conversion Table
sites.description: Conversion factor spreadsheet translating construction material volumes into standardized weight estimates for compliance reporting.

sites.title: Australian Government — National Waste Report (At a Glance)
sites.description: National snapshot of Australian waste flows with Sankey visualizations, recovery trends, and sector comparisons for benchmarking.

sites.title: UK Government — Waste Statistics Open Data Portal
sites.description: Open data release covering UK waste statistics, including construction and demolition streams, with downloadable CSV datasets.

sites.title: US EPA — Sustainable Management of C&D Materials
sites.description: EPA guidance hub aggregating policy context, material reuse strategies, and national statistics for construction and demolition waste.

sites.title: US EPA — State & Local C&D Measurement Reports
sites.description: Curated directory of state and local measurement reports documenting diversion methodologies, program results, and reporting templates.
